intro: Crypsinus wuliangshanensis, commonly known as the Wuliangshan crypsinus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Wuliangshan Mountains in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within montane forests. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
